intro: Piper minutispicum, commonly known as the small-spurred pepper plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, spicate inflorescences and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of rainforests. The fruit, which is small and fleshy, contains seeds that are dispersed by animals.
